text: hi everyone today I will make chair Bob
or Vietnamese corn pudding is a great
dessert but very simple to make so let's
begin
for this recipe you will need glutinous
corn on the cob it's very popular in
Vietnam but not so easy to find in
Western countries so I had to bite it
frozen at Asian grocery store if you can
get fresh ones that will be perfect use
a peeler to slide the corn thing Lee
just runned out the cough and the thing
Lee's light cone will fall off if you
don't have a pillar like that you can
also use a normal knife sometimes you
can even get the priests light cone
frozen at Asian grocery store so you
don't even have to slice it bring four
cups or one liter of water to a boil and
cook the cup for about 15 minutes they
will release the sweetness into our soup
then remove and discard the cops add
half a cup of sugar and stir well to
dissolve also add a pinch of salt to
modern the taste of sugar then add the
sliced corn and cook for about 10
minutes or until soft in a small bowl
add about 3 to 4 tbsp of tapioca starch
it will be used to thicken the soup then
add a tablespoon of water you can adjust
the amount of top you can stash
depending whether you want your soup to
be runny or a thick
then stir well to dissolve when the cone
is nicely cooked and soft slowly adding
the tapioca mixture why constantly
stirring and cooking on medium heat the
tapioca slab will turn translucent as is
it cooked and will thicken our soup
that's it we are done you can either
serve when it's still hot or let it cool
down and chill in the fridge it's going
to be good either way but just note that
the soup will get thicker when it's cold
so just make sure that you put in the
right amount of tapioca starch finally
add in some vanilla or vanilla sugar
later to a serving bowl and resource
some coconut sauce on top
just stir well and enjoy it tastes
really good in the summer when chilled I
hope you like it and thank you for
watching bye
you
